subject: Productivity
title: What Procrastination Really Is
description: A quick win: understand What Procrastination Really Is.

hook.text: Procrastination isn't laziness. It's choosing short-term comfort over long-term benefit.

buildup.text: Psychologists define it as voluntarily delaying a task despite knowing the delay will hurt you.

discovery.text: About 20% of adults are chronic procrastinators. It affects health, finances, and relationships.

twist.text: Procrastinators often work hard â€” just on the wrong things. Busyness masks the avoidance.

climax.text: Understanding procrastination as an emotion problem, not a time problem, changes everything.

punchline.text: Procrastination is a mood problem, not a clock problem.
